co.cask.cdap.api.workflow
Interface WorkflowAction

All Superinterfaces:
Runnable
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractWorkflowAction, ProgramWorkflowAction
public interface WorkflowAction
extends Runnable

Represents an action that can be executed in a Workflow. The lifecycle of a WorkflowAction is: 

 try {
   initialize(WorkflowContext)
   Runnable.run()
   // Success
 } catch (Exception e) {
   // Failure
 } finally {
   destroy()
 }

Method Summary
 WorkflowActionSpecification configure()
          Provides a specification for this WorkflowAction.
 void destroy()
          This method is called after the Runnable.run() method completes and it can be used for resource cleanup.
 void initialize(WorkflowContext context)
          Initializes a WorkflowAction.
 
Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Runnable
run
 

Method Detail

configure

WorkflowActionSpecification configure()
Provides a specification for this WorkflowAction.

Returns:
An instance of WorkflowSpecification.

initialize

void initialize(WorkflowContext context)
                throws Exception
Initializes a WorkflowAction. This method is called before the Runnable.run() method.

Parameters:
context - Context object containing runtime information for this action.
Throws:
Exception - If there is any error during initialization. When an exception is thrown, the execution of this action is treated as failure of the Workflow.

destroy

void destroy()
This method is called after the Runnable.run() method completes and it can be used for resource cleanup. Any exception thrown only gets logged but does not affect execution of the Workflow.
